intro: Bicornella hirtula, commonly known as the hairy bicornella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in grassy or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
